block.p: Jenny Gim-Hung Lam, a daughter of Shiu Ling Lam and Wah Tim Lam of Manhattan, is to be married today to Darrell Kee Low, the son of Teresa C. Low and Ernest Kee Low of Elmhurst, Queens. The Rev. Dr. James G. Speer will perform the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church in Manhattan.

The bride, 37, is a vice president at Chase Manhattan Bank, where she manages small-business lending for the bank's community development group. She is a vice chairwoman of the New York State Democratic Committee and of the Chinese-American Planning Council, a social services and education agency in Manhattan. She is also a Democratic district leader for the Lower East Side and Chinatown. She graduated cum laude from Yale University. Her parents retired as the owners of the Jade Cafe, a former restaurant in Chinatown.

Jenny Gim-Hung Lam, a daughter of Shiu Ling Lam and Wah Tim Lam of Manhattan, is to be married today to Darrell Kee Low, the son of Teresa C. Low and Ernest Kee Low of Elmhurst, Queens. The Rev. Dr. James G. Speer will perform the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church in Manhattan.

The bride, 37, is a vice president at Chase Manhattan Bank, where she manages small-business lending for the bank's community development group. She is a vice chairwoman of the New York State Democratic Committee and of the Chinese-American Planning Council, a social services and education agency in Manhattan. She is also a Democratic district leader for the Lower East Side and Chinatown. She graduated cum laude from Yale University. Her parents retired as the owners of the Jade Cafe, a former restaurant in Chinatown.

The bridegroom, 33, is a vice president and computer systems manager at Goldman, Sachs & Company in Manhattan. He graduated from Cooper Union. His mother is a librarian and teacher at Public School 143 in Corona, Queens. His father is a computer programmer and analyst for the Visiting Nurse Service of New York in Manhattan.
